metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Java uses the + operator for both addition and concatenation.
content.html: Java uses the + operator for both addition and concatenation.

content.text: Numbers are added. Strings are concatenated.
If you add two numbers, the result will be a number:
content.html: If you add two numbers, the result will be a number:

content.code:
int
x
=

10
;


int
y
=

20
;


int
z
=
x
+
y
;

// z will be 30 (an integer/number)
content.code_html:
int x = 10;
int y = 20;
int z = x + y;  // z will be 30 (an integer/number)

content.text: If you add two strings, the result will be a string concatenation:
content.html: If you add two strings, the result will be a string concatenation:

content.code:
String
x
=

"10"
;


String
y
=

"20"
;


String
z
=
x
+
y
;

// z will be 1020 (a String)
content.code_html:
String x = "10";
String y = "20";
String z = x + y;  // z will be 1020 (a String)

content.text: If you add a number and a string, the result will be a string concatenation:
content.html: If you add a number and a string, the result will be a string concatenation:

content.code:
String
x
=

"10"
;


int
y
=

20
;


String
z
=
x
+
y
;

// z will be 1020 (a String)
content.code_html:
String x = "10";
int y = 20;
String z = x + y;  // z will be 1020 (a String)

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
Java uses the + operator for both addition and concatenation. True or False: Strings are added and numbers are concatenated.
content.html:
Java uses the + operator for both addition and concatenation.

True or False:
Strings are added and numbers are concatenated.
